parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the crew (both dead and alive) of the given vehicle.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''crew''' vehicleName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicleName: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] -  An array with all units in the vehicle is returned.
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[in]] ([[crew]] _tank);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[commander]], [[driver]], [[gunner]], [[fullCrew]], [[assignedVehicleRole]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 3 February, 2010 - 11:28</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Ofpwarior|Ofpwarior]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The [[crew]] command will return crew in order [driver,gunner,commander,turrets,cargo]

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 1 June, 2014 - 18:17</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:SilentSpike|SilentSpike]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The [[crew]] command will return an empty array if the object has no crew - this includes objects that can't hold crew. If used on a unit (man, module, etc.) it will return an array containing that unit.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>



[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|CREW]]
